meanings.definition: Lack of power or ability to take effective action
meanings.sent1: His impotences in decision-making often led to delays in the project.
meanings.sent2: The impotences of the old machine made it difficult to complete the task efficiently.
meanings.sent3: Despite his impotences in leadership, he always managed to motivate his team.
meanings.sent4: The impotences of the tiny engine were evident when it struggled to pull the heavy load.
meanings.sent5: The student's impotences in solving complex math problems frustrated him.

meanings.definition: Inability to achieve or maintain an erection
meanings.sent1: His impotences caused him embarrassment during intimate moments.
meanings.sent2: The medication helped him overcome his impotences and regain confidence.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his impotences, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The stress at work often resulted in temporary impotences for him.
meanings.sent5: His impotences became a concern, prompting him to seek medical advice.

meanings.sent1: The plant showed impotences in growth due to poor soil quality.
meanings.sent2: Her impotences after the long hike made her realize the need for more exercise.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's impotences in catching the toy amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The impotences of the old bridge were evident when it couldn't bear the weight of the truck.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's impotences in the final lap cost him the victory.
